runs.comm: a shade of awayswing to start off at 142 kph, well that's good to know. He's been hounded about his fitness and his pace for a while. The fuller delivery on off stump is bunted to mid-on

133 kph, yorker on middle and off goes the top! Curls away from leg stump and bangs into the base of middle like it was a heat-seeker. Pristine start from Sri Lanka's captain and Johnson Charles is out for a duck
139kph, full and slanted a bit too far down leg, Samuels just needed to get a little bit of bat on it. Four to long leg

stranded in his crease as Malinga cranks it back up past the 140kph mark. This is the awayswinger, full and slightly wide of off stump. Samuels wafts at it ungainly - his weight falling back and his hands going forward. Obviously didn't connect

139 kph, looks to reenact the Johnson dismissal. It's the awayswinger curling from leg stump and looking for the base of middle. Full toss it was. But unlike Charles, Samuels plants the straight bat down and gets a single to mid-on
full and just outside off, Fletcher goes for the audacious drive on the up, gets a thick edge over point
back of a length and just outside off, flayed and mistimed to mid-off
back of a length on middle and leg, clipped through square leg
stands and delivers a flick to send the good length ball on middle towards long leg
finds the yorker on middle, but this is a straight delivery unlike Malinga's slingy benders. Safely handled
full on middle, driven to long-off. No real footwork there
back of a length and slower, Samuels looks to back away and cut but only gets a bottom edge
play and miss as Malinga gets away with a length ball that had room. Intended slower ball, which comes out at 130 kph. The slingy angle is doing the trick against the inexperienced Fletcher

full and tailing in this time, Fletcher was walking at the bowler, premeditating the fuller length. Gets the full toss he wanted and picks it through midwicket. Timed surprisingly well and it was too good for the fielder Siriwardana as well
offcutter right on middle stump, defended
130 kph, picked up on the batsman agitating. Bowls shorter and cuts his room down. Fletcher who had committed to coming down the track only inside edges the cut
slower ball on off stump, no room on offer, Fletcher blocks it with soft hands looking to a dab-and-run. No dice
short, slow and outside off, slid down to short third man

run out chance, Fletcher had given up! But Malinga misses. It had been stroked to mid-off. Nothing on offer there but the two batsmen take way too long in getting to that conclusion. Ample time on offer, but it looks like Malinga needs to bowl and bot throw to hit the mark
offcutter goes down leg, Samuels tries to flick it away but to no avail
picks up a single in the cover region
runs down the track, the length is immediately halved, pummeled to long-on
full toss on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
picked up and dropped over the square leg boundary. Short delivery, sitting up at Kula's pace, Fletcher shifted his weight back, got inside the line and swung free
full on off stump, pasted wide of long-on but Chandimal is an agile fielder. Was also helped by the fact that the timing hadn't been in top order
steps down the track, that's the pressure of a big total. He can't take his time. Has to go straight away. Sachi gets the ball to drift away with the arm and finds an outside edge.

you beauty! Sachi held the ball back, as though he had skipped to the future and knew Samuels would be running down the track. The batsman continued with the shot despite the fact. Went high rather than long and Milinda Siriwardana takes a wonderful skier running around at deep midwicket
eased towards point
tossed up on middle and leg, Fletcher cannot reach the pitch after moving forward and can only tuck it to the right of the bowler
early rush down the pitch, so Sachi bowls it flat and quick down leg. Picked away to deep midwicket

try, try and try again until you whack him out of the park. They know only one way to play and Fletcher races down the track, this time it is the tossed up delivery that comes on nicely to the bat and is launched over long-on.
too quick! This was back of a length at 141 kph, Russell backs away for a hack through midwicket but cannot make contact
short and wide outside off, Russell helps it on its way over the wicketkeeper's head. Sweet hit. Smart hit
that time he nailed it. Short and angled into the pads at 143 kph, seemed to skid on as well. Russell adjust by crouching a touch and pulling to deep square leg
picks up the short ball and pulls it miles over square leg. Sat back and basically helped it on its way because Chameera has the pace to exploit. Almost a shovel hit
beautiful yorker! Tailed in late and nearly toppled the batsman off his feet. The dream inswinging yorker that has the batsman looking like a hot potato

looks to repeat it, but this is a length ball and Fletcher has heaved it into the now silent Pallekele crowd. Holds his pose, looking like a man who is absolutely seething. Punches gloves with Russell, and I mean really punches
length ball on off stump, pushed into the off side

dances down and lifts the ball over long-on. And then walks down the pitch with the bat held aloft in the followthrough. Sweet hit, got to the pitch, held back to adjust to the slower pace and then pummeled it
fired in down leg and picked away behind square leg

flat and short and outside off, feeding the batsman's strength because his mind has been scrambled by Fletcher running at him. Russell is the batsman here and he has hit the hardest and the flattest six over wide long-on
/oh, how did that miss off stump?! he camps back again to look for that pick up shot over the on side. But the ball stays low and skirts under the bat

length ball outside off, pasted to long-on as the bat turns in his hand. Hitting it that hard, almost concentrating on nothing else. Except his running perhaps. Excellent work. Actually, it is Fletcher's work. Russell was taking it easy, but his partner was whizzing up and down
short and wide and carved past the off-side ring. Siriwardana is the new bowler, who delivers a short ball with some room. Not the ball you want to bowl with no man deep at point
full toss outside off, whipped through midwicket to record a fifty in only 22 balls. Massive innings, would build his confidence to no end. Fourth fastest in WI cricket

bye, bye baby! Round arm dart does the trick. Russell should not have hung back on that one. Worse still, he was trying to launch a near yorker down the ground for a six. The ball slinks below his bat and topples his sticks. Awful shot. Like I said, he was just concentrating on power. Nothing else
tossed up and slower, Bravo comes forward to nudge it towards the leg side. Gets a leg bye instead

nearly caught on the boundary! But Fletcher has got just enough power to make it soar over his head. It was Chandimal there, he had come in - misjudgment there - and didn't recover fast enough to go back and take it
fired in down the leg side, collects the wide
tossed up on middle, slog swept to deep midwicket

goes away from his status quo, gets the surprise factor in his favour, and he has a wicket to his name! Well done. Everyone goes ga ga about his pace, but here is some guile. He had been pasted for three sixes because of his extra few yards and now he starts off with the legcutter. Fletcher made room to cut from the stumps, but he was early into the set up. So he has to wait midway through the shot and time it perfectly. He does not and loses his off stump
146kph, now back at full pace and sliding down leg. That's a good plan against Pollard who has the occasional trouble with the out and out quick. Needs to get his radar working better

ripper again! This is 138 kph, and kicks up off back of a length. Pollard was shaping up to clip it off his hips, but it skids onto him too quickly. He has always been suspect at that region, cramped up on the back foot on leg stump
bangs it in way too short and Pollard just watches it sail outside his eyeline
144kph, back of a length on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
142kph, back of a length and just outside off, Pollard displays a forward defensive. But his front foot moves almost after the shot.
oh well done. Pollard again moves forward only after he played the shot. Opens the face and glides the back of a length delivery past the right of the wicketkeeper
shortish on middle, Pollard walks at him and flicks it to long leg
pushed through on off stump, defended
down the track, reaches the pitch and belts it past long-on. He only had to move a couple of paces, but Pollard's timing - note here, timing not out and out power - beats him. Lovely, proper batting
well bowled. Held this back and angled it into the right-hander. Pollard went through with the flick way too early and wears it on the pads
that time when he ran down the track and looked to power the ball away, he gets it off the inside half of the bat to deep square leg. Ball was angled in and dipped on him
flighted on middle and leg, Bravo plants his front leg right across and looks to flick around it. Not going to work

that's brilliant batting, that's trademark Bravo. Has room outside off and even with it being almost a yorker, he just sways that torso back and flays at it with his hands. The open blade finds the gap between point and cover. Pure Calyspo skill.
shortish on middle and leg, dabbed towards square leg and Chameera has to go get it himself

right off the toe, because Bravo had been weaving away from the shot. Trying to hit it too hard, I guess. It's the slower delivery - the offcutter - and it fools another batsman. Single down the ground instead of the belt over cover
short and a shade outside off, Pollard was looking to glide it to third man but he is hustled for pace
the short-pitched attack continues and this is a lovely one. Dug in and soaring above his left shoulder. Pollard was looking to defend it, but then realises he needs to drop his wrists and sway away

fine leg up in the circle, dead giveaway for the slower ball, Pollard knew it and he was walking down rather early. Chameera adjusts by bowling the leg cutter at a shorter length. Nudged, in the air, towards midwcket
back of a length and outside off, slid to deep third man
full toss just outside off, driven through the covers

in the slot and Pollard has wound up and went bang. Waited nicely to unleash. Saw the length early, cleared the front leg and away she flew. And it looks like that ball is not going to work anymore. Replacement provided

Kapugedera pulls off a Jonty-esque catch! It was pasted. Flat and hard and had six written all over it. Except the fielder ran to his left and just flew. The fairytale end would have been him hitting the ground and springing back up with ball still in hand. Instead, he had palmed it over for six
faster and flatter outside off, patted to long-on where Kapu gets into the act again. Gets a high-five from a team-mate
dropped by the keeper. Harsh chance through as Bravo backed away and cut as hard as he could possibly do.
clipped to deep midwicket
pulled over the midwicket boundary, which has been pulled in a bit. But make no mistake, this is a pretty big ground around those areas

fired in flat and in the slot, Bravo just steps forward and swings free. Sri Lanka missing a trick here. They are bowling too fast and the WI batsmen are treating them like medium pacers. No need to worry about turn
flat and short and outside off, Bravo has skewered it between point and third man. Vicious cut. That's the fifty partnership, off only 28 balls

goes back over the wicket and he strikes! Bravo was looking for the late cut. And it was there. Short delivery wide of off stump, should have been easy pickings, but the batsman gets a lot finer touch than he intended and Kusal takes a good catch. Yelped out about three different appeals in glee until the finger was raised. Stayed low and moved with the ball
flighted on middle and leg, nudged through midwicket
flatter and shorter and outside off, Pollard looks leg side as he closes the face and mistimes it to long-on

the biggest grin you will ever see comes from Kula after the easiest catch in the world! Bad finish for Pollard. Another ball that was there in the slot, but somehow when he actually had to have torn the leather off the ball, he seems to just have chipped it. Carries clean to the long-on fielder
fuller delivery outside off, lashed through cover. Right through the fielder, I mean
shorter delivery outside off, punched to long-off
leans forward to a good length delivery that turns away. Holder drops it in front of point and races away
looks for the heave ho over square leg. But he is into the shot too early. Gets a top edge and goes high into the air. Square leg running in from the deep cant get there in time
fired in on middle and leg, blocked
thought about the bigger, but Sammy thinks twice because the ball does not have room and it did not afford him any room.

Kapu gets a lot simpler chance to ease the disappointment of not pulling off that screamer earlier. This one is getting done early folks. It was a short ball, Sammy had set up for the flat-batted pull. Again the right shot, but the execution is not the best

another one does down trying to go up and over. Its the one-finger slider again from Sachi, like the last ball. Holder runs down the ground to heave it away. Drags it to straight midwicket where Siriwardana takes a very composed catch

bowls over the stumps now, and its a pretty good ball for the hat-trick too. Right at the stumps and keeping a shade low too. Probably because the batsman was plying a fuller ball off the back foot. Defended well enough though
picked away through the leg side
short and wide, Narine tapped to long-off. That's Sachi's best in T20 cricket.
slower ball, short and outside off, Narine waits and dabs to deep third man
slow and full this time, Taylor defends. Looks like they are trying to last the full quota now. Can't get 70 off 29 with the last two wickets

well, what do I know. Here he swings a slower, back of a length delivery away to deep square leg. Wanted the big heave, beaten by the lack of pace on the ball. The top edge skews up high. Chandimal races in as hard as he could from the deep, dives forward to try and snaffle it up. But he is not sure if he had taken it cleanly. The umps have chat, go upstairs and replays reveal a bump ball. Shouldn't take anything away from the effort though.
short and wide, patted to deep cover
slower ball, angled in at the body. Taylor tries to make room and glides it to point

he becomes a merry-go-round in his crease as Malinga dupes him with a slower ball. Swiveling aimlessly on his back foot, the bat held in only one hand as he is beaten for the lack of pace by the back of a length ball on off stump
full on off stump, toe-ended to deep midwicket
runs down the track, gets a full toss which ends up a high one because of that, and only a single through the covers
the slower ball goes awfully wide. And it doesn't pitch until it passes the batsman
edged and through to the boundary before the keeper could do anything. Almost a pity boundary that
short, Narine goes for the cut and misses because it is too far outside off
picks up the short ball and launches it over the square leg boundary. Magnificent pull shot. And yet it was all in slow motion. Narine's touch.
had his back leg way outside off, Kula follows it with his low full toss, Narine slogs it to long-on
another full toss that Taylor takes off his hips and to deep midwicket. Seventeen off the over, but West Indies are long gone in this contest
the offcutter at a shortish length again, Narine slices it off the open face to deep cover
through him - Taylor goes for a heave too early - Malinga's offcutter sneaks between leg stump and the batsman
that time he makes the pace against the short, offcutter. Jumps down the track and belts it to deep midwicket
short and outside off, back foot pull now but it manifests as an inside edge to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, guided to point

skier, swirler, difficult one, but not to Chandimal at deep square leg. Had his eyes all the way on it. Was nicely balanced under it, and let it come down into his hands. Lovely technique. This was a length ball that Taylor wanted to send into orbit. But hadn't accounted for the change of pace
full and wide outside off, Bishoo goes for a flat-footed cover drive. No connection
hits the yorker on off stump, squeezed out to cover
moves away from the short ball and provides a ramp for it to travel to third man
full and wide outside off, Narine reaches for it and does not connect
full and outside off, Narine plants his back leg across outside off and heaves it away wide of long-on. Shehan  dives, but it had too much on it
short and wide, slapped to deep point
slid down the leg side, too far for the batsman to connect and too much for the wicketkeeper. By the way, Shehan is bowling with only 42 required
shimmies down and hammers it back at the bowler
flat and quick on leg stump, heaved away to deep midwicket
reverse sweep, one bounce for. All the more better for the shot that it was a flat and quick delivery. The only thing the bowler gave was the width to swing those arms
eased into the covers
and bingo was his name-o! Sri Lanka will retain their No. 1 ranking in T20s. Quick and on target, it was seam up as well instead of the offie. Narine misses, Shehan hits
